llama2-70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 18th): Drive from Charlotte to Milwaukee, Wisconsin (duration: 13 hours 1 min, distance: 1,371 km, cost: $68)

* Check-in at a child-friendly accommodation with private rooms in Milwaukee.
* Visit the Harley-Davidson Museum (ticket price: $20 per person, duration: 2 hours).
* Have dinner at one of the top-rated family-friendly restaurants in Milwaukee such as Comet Cafe, Sweet Diner, or Odd Duck.

Day 2 (March 19th): Explore Milwaukee

* Visit the Milwaukee County Zoo (admission price: $15 per person, duration: 3 hours).
* Have lunch at a family-friendly restaurant in Milwaukee.
* Spend the afternoon exploring the Lakefront Brewery or taking a stroll along the Milwaukee RiverWalk.
* Have dinner at one of the top-rated family-friendly restaurants in Milwaukee.

Day 3 (March 20th): Drive to Marquette, Wisconsin (duration: 6 mins, distance: 2.0 km, cost: $0)

* Check-in at a child-friendly accommodation with private rooms in Marquette.
* Visit the Upper Peninsula Children's Museum (admission price: $10 per person, duration: 2 hours).
* Have dinner at a family-friendly restaurant in Marquette such as The Vierling Restaurant & Marquette Harbor Brewery.

Day 4 (March 21st): Explore Marquette

* Take a scenic drive to the Marquette Lake Shore Trail and enjoy a leisurely walk along the lake (duration: 3 hours).
* Have lunch at a family-friendly restaurant in Marquette.
* Visit the Marquette Regional History Center (admission price: $7 per person, duration: 2 hours).
* Have dinner at one of the top-rated family-friendly restaurants in Marquette.

Day 5 (March 22nd): Drive back to Charlotte from Marquette (duration: 13 hours 1 min, distance: 1,371 km, cost: $68)

* Check out of the accommodation and start driving back to Charlotte.
* Stop for lunch at a family-friendly restaurant along the way.
* Continue driving and reach Charlotte by evening.

Budget Breakdown:

* Accommodation (4 nights): $1,000
* Transportation (fuel for driving): $260
* Attractions (Harley-Davidson Museum, Milwaukee County Zoo, Upper Peninsula Children's Museum, Marquette Lake Shore Trail, Marquette Regional History Center): $135
* Food and dining (4 lunches, 4 dinners): $700
* Miscellaneous (snacks, souvenirs, unexpected expenses): $105
Total: $2,500

This itinerary should fit your budget of $2,500 and provide a fun and memorable family trip to Wisconsin without any flights.
